image.altText: Family members descend stairs outside a red brick building with green trees.

props.synopsis: Parents sobbed, embraced and covered their faces with their hands as photos of the jumping castle at the centre of a tragedy that killed six children in 2021 were shown to a Tasmanian court.

title.children: Parents grief overflows as photos of jumping castle shown in Hillcrest tragedy criminal case

image.altText: Young woman with hair pulled back, looks to the left of camera

props.synopsis: A woman is jailed for three-and-a-half years for killing a Queensland tourist after falling asleep at the wheel while intoxicated on cannabis and meth and driving into oncoming traffic. She also had an infant in the car at the time of the crash in Tasmania.

title.children: Driver filmed herself smoking cannabis before falling asleep and killing Queensland tourist

image.altText: Aerial photos of the University of Tasmania.

props.synopsis: A plan for Tasmania's university to develop a "city centric" campus in Hobart has been scaled back, with science, technology, engineering and maths (STEM) to stay on at its current Sandy Bay campus.

title.children: University of Tasmania pulls pin on full shift into Hobart CBD

image.altText: A blurred photo of dead labradoodle puppies, adult dogs and a lamb in a chest freezer.

props.synopsis: Former workers at Tasmania's then-largest puppy farm have broken their silence, revealing details about what they saw happen and were asked to do while working at Tasmanian Labradoodles.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ 'The biggest mistake of my life': Former workers at labradoodle puppy farm speak out

image.altText: Traffic light showing the image of a bicycle illuminated red.

props.synopsis: A Hobart business group unhappy with a trial of bike lanes in the city centre says it will seek to force a poll of all city residents over the matter.

title.children: Hobart business group threatens elector poll over proposed CBD bike lane

image.altText: The Spirit of Tasmania leaves Devonport as the sun sets.

props.synopsis: The new Spirit of Tasmania ferries will have more space for caravans and motor homes, but, with their arrival delayed, the struggle for holiday-makers to get a booking continues.

title.children: Unhappy campers unable to squeeze on to Spirits as ship operator works to find space

image.altText: A snowy mountain summit.

props.synopsis: Yet another group of wannabe adventurers have had to be pulled out of the Tasmanian wilderness after conditions turned on them and wild winds destroyed their tents.

title.children: Hikers rescued from Tasmania's Mount Anne region after weather rips tents apart

image.altText: Shadow Transport Minister Bridget McKenzie

props.synopsis: The shadow transport minister admits she received 16 free flight upgrades that she failed to declare, after previously claiming she had never received a complimentary upgrade.

title.children: Bridget McKenzie admits to 16 previously undisclosed free flight upgrades

image.altText: Donald Trump pumps his fist in front of an American flag alongside his family.

props.synopsis: US Vice-President Kamala Harris is expected to call Donald Trump shortly to concede defeat in the presidential election, according to US media. Follow live.

title.children: US election 2024 live: Kamala Harris to congratulate Donald Trump on presidential election win

image.altText: A hand is clicking a drop down menu choosing Trump or Harris. The background is a hexagonal map of US animating from blue to red

props.synopsis: Use our interactive election map to explore just how big Donald Trump's victory might be in the end.

title.children: Explore the scale of Trump's triumph

image.altText: harris looks over her shoulder while speaking on a mobile phone

props.synopsis: Many analysts predict the election will go down to the wire, and be among the closest in the country's history.

title.children: Republicans within striking distance of election triumph as swing states turn red

image.altText: An American flag flies in the wind over a sign that says "voting place"

props.synopsis: There are 50 American states, but there are only seven states people are paying attention to this presidential election.Â

title.children: What are swing states? Why is everyone talking about them?

image.altText: split screen of donald trump on the left, and kamala harris on the right

props.synopsis: Follow the results from the US presidential election as the count happens. Analyse the ABC News state map that shows what it will take to win the White House.

title.children: Follow the latest results of the 2024 US election

image.altText: USA Votes live stream image

props.synopsis: Follow live as the US decides if Donald Trump or Kamala Harris will win the presidency.

title.children: Watch the ABC News live coverage of the US election

image.altText: A photo of a very skinny child dancer with her face blurred.

props.synopsis: A dangerously emaciated teenager was a "fussy eater" who ate three meals a day, her father says as he takes the stand in his defence at his trial for allegedly starving her.

title.children: Father of malnourished ballerina rejects claims of 'childlike' tastes, says she liked Married At First Sight

image.altText: Tony Burke speaks at a press conference at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The federal government is moving urgently to write new regulations to allow ankle monitoring and curfews for people released from immigration detention in the NZYQ ruling, after the High Court ruled those conditions unlawful.

title.children: Government moves to urgently reimpose ankle monitors and curfews for 'NZYQ' group after High Court rules them unlawful

image.altText: A young boy in a black tee short holds up two fish.

props.synopsis: 11-year-old Laith Alaid was swept out to sea on Sunday after attempting to cross The Entrance Channel with his family and emergency services have been looking for him since.Â

title.children: Body found in water in search for missing 11yo boy swept out to sea

props.synopsis: John Barron and Chas Licardello take a look at the US election results so far and the surprising surge in Latino votes for Trump according to exit polls.

title.children: Planet America looks at the surprising US election results so far

image.altText: A large chunk of blackened land surrounding a small regional town.

props.synopsis: Temperatures are pushing into the forties in the eastern states as the focus shifts to an "extensive" thunderstorm risk.Â

title.children: 'Extensive' thunderstorm risk in eastern Australia as temperatures push into the 40s

image.altText: Army troops walk in grass

props.synopsis: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, in his nightly video address, thanked those in the world who, he said, had reacted to the dispatch of North Korean troops to Russia last month "not just with words â€¦ but who are preparing actions to support our defence".

title.children: First clash between Ukrainian and North Korean troops reported

image.altText: a woman in black walks up steps

props.synopsis: Parents sobbed, embraced and covered their faces with their hands as photos of blood stains on the jumping castle at the centre of a tragedy that killed six children in 2021 were shown to a Tasmanian court.

title.children: Parents' grief overflows as photos of jumping castle shown in Hillcrest tragedy criminal case

image.altText: People at voting booths

props.synopsis: The FBI says Russian actors may have been behind dozens of false bomb threats targeting voting centres in swing states.

title.children: Russia blamed for hoax bomb threats targeting multiple US polling stations

image.altText: Female tennis players post in evening wear with the WTA trophy.

props.synopsis: Activists with sisters who have been imprisoned in Saudi Arabia are urging tennis players not to stay silent about the plight of women in the country during the Women's Tennis Association Finals.

title.children: Female tennis players accused of complicity in Saudi Arabia 'sportswashing'

image.altText: A graphic illustration of a Toyota, showing the DPF filter in the engine.

props.synopsis: The action was brought by thousands of people who bought faulty Toyota and Ford cars between 2015-2020.

title.children: High Court to allow appeal from Toyota and Ford owners in compensation case over faulty vehicles

image.altText: A sign that says "Newcastle District Court" outside a building

props.synopsis: The woman, diagnosed with dissociative identity disorder, has been giving evidence in Newcastle during the child sexual abuse trial of her father SN, who has pleaded not guilty to 26 offences.

title.children: From teen to carer, woman's second alternate identity takes the stand in child sex abuse trial

image.altText: A DHL plane

props.synopsis: Parcels that exploded at logistics depots in Europe were part of a test run for a Russian plot to trigger explosions on cargo flights to the United States, the security officials said.Â

title.children: Exploding parcels in Europe part of Russian plot to target US cargo flights, officials say

image.altText: Prince William and Robert Irwin

props.synopsis: Prince William has gone on an early-morning nature walk with Australian conservationist Robert Irwin to promote the work of rangers in a unique national park in South Africa.

title.children: Prince William meets Robert Irwin during climate-focused South Africa trip

image.altText: A person in a jacket expressing support for the CFMEU.

props.synopsis: Several workers in the construction sector say they will not speak to the CFMEU administrator about their experiences with the union because insufficient legal protections mean they fear retribution.

title.children: Construction insiders fear speaking out against CFMEU without whistleblower protections

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt smiles beside a black horse.

props.synopsis: When Knight's Choice was born in northern New South Wales five years ago, 76-year-old breeder Norm Bazeley never dreamed he would become a stayer in the race that stops the nation.

title.children: As the foal of a $1,000 mare, Knight's Choice was never meant to win the Melbourne Cup

image.altText: Ruben Amorim gestures at a press conference.

props.synopsis: RÃºben Amorim does not officially start his job as Manchester United manager until early next week but his first clash with British media has already captured global attention.

title.children: British journalist accused of 'entitlement' after insisting Portuguese manager speak English

image.altText: Close-up of shark with wide, flat head with its mouth open and shark teeth exposed

props.synopsis: Is your shark knowledge a bit â€¦ fishy? Let's find out how well you know these impressive ocean predators.

title.children: Shark quiz: How much do you know about great whites and megalodons?

image.altText: Dark smoke over a rural town.

props.synopsis: The Baloone Shire mayor is proud of how Dirranbandi locals pulled together and supported one another through the emergency, declaring it now safe to return.

title.children: Residents given green light to return home as bushfire in regional Queensland de-escalates

image.altText: The charred remains of an aircraft

props.synopsis:
The Australian Transport and Safety Bureau says minimum safe drop limits should be rolled out nationally in a bid to avoid a repeat of a 2023 crash in WA.

title.children: Investigation into 'miracle' 737 water bomber crash calls for minimum drop heights

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside the ACT Supreme Court with a serious expression, wearing glasses and a tie. He has a beard.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's appeal against defamation case findings delayed
